column1: Something went wrong while saving this configuration:
column2: Something went wrong while saving this configuration:

column1: Please confirm scope switching. All data that hasn't been saved will be lost.
column2: Please confirm scope switching. All data that hasn't been saved will be lost.

column1: A number between 0 and 1. Used as automatic stopwords detection threshold.
column2: A number between 0 and 1. Used as automatic stopwords detection threshold.

column1: Allowed values "1", "2" or "AUTO". See doc here for more information.
column2: Allowed values "1", "2" or "AUTO". See doc here for more information.

column1: An integer between greater or equal than 0. See doc here for more information.
column2: An integer between greater or equal than 0. See doc here for more information.

column1: List of servers in [host]:[port] format separated by a comma (e.g. : "es-node1.fqdn:9200, es-node2.fqdn:9200")
column2: List of servers in [host]:[port] format separated by a comma (e.g. : "es-node1.fqdn:9200, es-node2.fqdn:9200")

column1: Select yes if you want to connect to your Elasticsearch server over HTTPS.
column2: Select yes if you want to connect to your Elasticsearch server over HTTPS.

column1: Enable this option when your Elasticsearch server use basic HTTP authentication.
column2: Enable this option when your Elasticsearch server use basic HTTP authentication.

column1: When enabled the module will produce logs through Magento logging system.
column2: When enabled the module will produce logs through Magento logging system.

column1: Maximum number of popular search terms to display in autocomplete results.
column2: Maximum number of popular search terms to display in autocomplete results.

column1: Select Yes if you want to display an ElasticSuite copyright link in the footer.
column2: Select Yes if you want to display an ElasticSuite copyright link in the footer.

column1: The value should be different to zero.
column2: The value should be different to zero.

column1: The number of replicas configured for Elasticsuite is incorrect. You cannot use %1 replicas since there is only %2 nodes in your Elasticsearch cluster.
column2: The number of replicas configured for Elasticsuite is incorrect. You cannot use %1 replicas since there is only %2 nodes in your Elasticsearch cluster.

column1: Click here to go to the Elasticsuite Config page and change your Number of Replicas per Index parameter according to our wiki page.
column2: Click here to go to the Elasticsuite Config page and change your Number of Replicas per Index parameter according to our wiki page.

column1: Number of words to match at the beginning of the string
column2: Number of words to match at the beginning of the string

column1: [Experimental] Use reference analyzer in exact matching filter query
column2: [Experimental] Use reference analyzer in exact matching filter query

column1: Experimental: Instead of the 'sku' field, use the 'reference' collector field which contains all searchable fields using the 'reference' analyzer when building the exact/most exact matching filter query. Useful for sku/reference matching.
column2: Experimental: Instead of the 'sku' field, use the 'reference' collector field which contains all searchable fields using the 'reference' analyzer when building the exact/most exact matching filter query. Useful for sku/reference matching.

column1: [Experimental] Use all tokens from term vectors
column2: [Experimental] Use all tokens from term vectors

column1: Experimental: Take into account all tokens from the term vectors response, instead of one token per position. Useful for sku/reference matching.
column2: Experimental: Take into account all tokens from the term vectors response, instead of one token per position. Useful for sku/reference matching.

column1: [Experimental] Use reference analyzer in term vectors
column2: [Experimental] Use reference analyzer in term vectors

column1: Experimental: Include the 'reference' collector field which contains all searchable fields using the 'reference' analyzer when performing the term vectors request. Useful for sku/reference matching.
column2: Experimental: Include the 'reference' collector field which contains all searchable fields using the 'reference' analyzer when performing the term vectors request. Useful for sku/reference matching.

column1: [Experimental] Use edge ngram analyzer in term vectors
column2: [Experimental] Use edge ngram analyzer in term vectors

column1: Experimental: Include the 'edge_ngram' collector field which contains all searchable fields using an analyzer containing an edge ngram component (like 'standard_edge_ngram') when performing the term vectors request. Useful for triggering exact matching on partial search terms that are only present in fields using an edge ngram component.
column2: Experimental: Include the 'edge_ngram' collector field which contains all searchable fields using an analyzer containing an edge ngram component (like 'standard_edge_ngram') when performing the term vectors request. Useful for triggering exact matching on partial search terms that are only present in fields using an edge ngram component.

column1: [Experimental] Use default analyzer in exact matching filter query
column2: [Experimental] Use default analyzer in exact matching filter query

column1: Experimental: Use the default analyzer of each field instead of the 'standard' analyzer for exact matching. Eg : for sku, it will try to match on 'sku.reference' field. If a field is using 'standard_edge_ngram' analyzer, it will try to match on 'field.standard_edge_ngram'. Useful for partial matching, or matching on beginning of words.
column2: Experimental: Use the default analyzer of each field instead of the 'standard' analyzer for exact matching. Eg : for sku, it will try to match on 'sku.reference' field. If a field is using 'standard_edge_ngram' analyzer, it will try to match on 'field.standard_edge_ngram'. Useful for partial matching, or matching on beginning of words.

column1: An integer greater than 0. Documents with a score lower than min_score are not included in the search results.
column2: An integer greater than 0. Documents with a score lower than min_score are not included in the search results.

column1: [Experimental] Enable single term custom boost values
column2: [Experimental] Enable single term custom boost values

column1: Experimental: By default, in an exact match query, when a single term is searched, the phrase match boost value (defaults to 10) is used to both a) boost matches in the 'whitespace' version of searchable attributes/fields, in addition of their own search weight and b) apply a double boost (so defaults to 20) on matches in the 'sortable' version of searchable+sortable attributes/fields, in addition of their own search weight. This puts a huge emphasis on accurate "exactly as the user typed it" matches compared to possible singular/plural/conjugated verbs variations. Enable this setting to allow you to choose alternative boost values to use in each case.
column2: Experimental: By default, in an exact match query, when a single term is searched, the phrase match boost value (defaults to 10) is used to both a) boost matches in the 'whitespace' version of searchable attributes/fields, in addition of their own search weight and b) apply a double boost (so defaults to 20) on matches in the 'sortable' version of searchable+sortable attributes/fields, in addition of their own search weight. This puts a huge emphasis on accurate "exactly as the user typed it" matches compared to possible singular/plural/conjugated verbs variations. Enable this setting to allow you to choose alternative boost values to use in each case.

column1: [Experimental] Single term phrase match boost value
column2: [Experimental] Single term phrase match boost value

column1: Experimental: When a single term is searched, a 'whitespace' (instead of 'shingle') part of the exact match query combines the attribute/field search weight with the phrase match boost value (defaults to 10). So for instance, the 'whitespace' version of a product 'name' attribute with a search weight of 5 would be boosted by 50. You can lower that boost value to reduce the scoring gaps between 'standard' exact matches and 'whitespace' exact matches.
column2: Experimental: When a single term is searched, a 'whitespace' (instead of 'shingle') part of the exact match query combines the attribute/field search weight with the phrase match boost value (defaults to 10). So for instance, the 'whitespace' version of a product 'name' attribute with a search weight of 5 would be boosted by 50. You can lower that boost value to reduce the scoring gaps between 'standard' exact matches and 'whitespace' exact matches.

column1: [Experimental] Single term sortable matches boost value
column2: [Experimental] Single term sortable matches boost value

column1: Experimental: The 'sortable' part of the exact match query combines the attribute/field search weight with twice the phrase match boost value (so defaults to 20). So for instance, the 'sortable' version of a product 'name' attribute with a search weight of 5 would be boosted by 100. You can lower that boost value to reduce the scoring gaps between 'standard' exact matches and 'sortable' exact matches.
column2: Experimental: The 'sortable' part of the exact match query combines the attribute/field search weight with twice the phrase match boost value (so defaults to 20). So for instance, the 'sortable' version of a product 'name' attribute with a search weight of 5 would be boosted by 100. You can lower that boost value to reduce the scoring gaps between 'standard' exact matches and 'sortable' exact matches.
